intro: Mastixia trichotoma var. korthalsiana, commonly known as the Korthals's mastixia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its woody stem and lanceolate leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in cyathia, typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is often found in lowland and hill forest areas, growing in shaded, humid environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
